intro: Nicotiana australis, commonly known as the Australian tobacco plant, is a species native to Australia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. This plant is characterized by its hairy stems, alternate leaves, and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Nicotiana australis is also known for its potential medicinal properties and historical use in traditional practices.
